Computes the distribution of exploration times.

The function:

  • Identifies exploration periods as the time spent in newly visited locations.
  • Fits a statistical distribution to the exploration time values.

Parameters:

data : TrajectoriesFrame A trajectory dataset containing labeled locations and timestamps.

Returns:

tuple: - model (distfit object): The fitted distribution model. - et (pd.Series): The computed exploration time values.

def msd_curve_split(self, *args, **kwargs): 
2404        def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs):
2405            msd_results, plot_obj = func(self, *args, **kwargs)  # type: ignore
2406            msd_curve = "; ".join(
2407                msd_results["RoG range [km]"] + ": " + msd_results["curve"]
2408            )
2409            msd_curve_params = "; ".join(
2410                msd_results["RoG range [km]"]
2411                + "("
2412                + msd_results["curve"]
2413                + ")"
2414                + ":"
2415                + msd_results["param1"].astype(str)
2416                + ","
2417                + msd_results["param2"].astype(str)
2418            )
2419
2420            self.stats_frame.add_data({"msd_curve": msd_curve})
2421            self.stats_frame.add_data({"msd_curve_params": msd_curve_params})
2422
2423            self.pdf_object.set_font("Arial", "B", size=8)
2424            self._add_pdf_cell("MSD split")
2425            y_position_global = float(self.pdf_object.get_y())
2426            self.pdf_object.ln(4)
2427            self._add_pdf_msd_split_table(msd_results)
2428            self._add_pdf_plot(
2429                plot_obj=plot_obj,
2430                image_width=80,
2431                image_height=45,
2432                x_position=125,
2433                y_position=y_position_global,
2434            )

Computes and groups MSD curves based on the radius of gyration (RoG).

The function:

  • Converts trajectory data to a GeoDataFrame.
  • Computes the center of mass and starting points for each trajectory.
  • Filters data to only include new explorations.
  • Computes MSD and RoG values for each group.
  • Groups MSD curves based on RoG bins and fits curves to them.

Parameters:

data : pd.DataFrame A dataset containing longitude and latitude coordinates.

Returns:

tuple: - msd_results (pd.DataFrame): Summary of MSD curve fitting for different RoG ranges. - buffer (BytesIO): A buffer containing the saved MSD plot.

def distinct_locations_over_time(self, *args, **kwargs): 
2183        def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs):

Computes the number of distinct locations visited over time.

The function:

  • Computes the cumulative number of distinct locations visited.
  • Fits a curve to model the growth of visited locations over time.

Parameters:

nrows : int Number of rows in the dataset. n_data : int Total data points available. data : pd.Series A dataset containing the count of distinct locations.

Returns:

tuple: - best_fit (str): Name of the best fitting model. - global_params (dict): Parameters of the best fit. - y_pred (ndarray): Predicted values from the curve fit. - expon_y_pred (ndarray): Alternative exponential model predictions. - pd.Series(data): The input data as a pandas Series. - ["t", "S(t)"] (list): Column labels.

def estimate_pnew(self, *args, **kwargs): 
2342        def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs):
2343            rho_est, gamma_est, DeltaS, S_mid, intercept, slope, nrows, n_data = func(
2344                self, *args, **kwargs
2345            )  # type: ignore
2346
2347            self.stats_frame.add_data({"rho": rho_est})
2348            self.stats_frame.add_data({"gamma": gamma_est})
2349
2350            self.pdf_object.set_font("Arial", "B", size=8)
2351            self._add_pdf_cell("Pnew estimation")
2352
2353            self.pdf_object.ln()
2354            self.pdf_object.ln()
2355            self.pdf_object.set_font("Arial", size=7)
2356            self._add_pdf_cell(f"gamma  = {gamma_est:.4f}")
2357            self._add_pdf_cell(f"rho  = {rho_est:.4f}")
2358            y_position_global = float(self.pdf_object.get_y())
2359            plot_obj1, plot_obj2 = self._plot_P_new(
2360                rho_est, gamma_est, DeltaS, S_mid, intercept, slope, nrows, n_data
2361            )
2362            self._add_pdf_plot(
2363                plot_obj=plot_obj1,
2364                image_width=80,
2365                image_height=45,
2366                x_position=10,
2367                y_position=y_position_global,
2368            )
2369            self._add_pdf_plot(
2370                plot_obj=plot_obj2,
2371                image_width=80,
2372                image_height=45,
2373                x_position=110,
2374                y_position=y_position_global,
2375            )

Estimates parameters (rho, gamma) for the probability of discovering new locations.

The function:

  • Computes the rate of discovery of new locations (P_new).
  • Fits a linear model in log-log space to estimate the parameters.

Parameters:

nrows : int Number of rows in the dataset. n_data : int Total data points available. S_t : list or np.array Sequence of distinct locations visited over time.

Returns:

tuple: - rho_hat (float): Estimated rho parameter. - gamma_hat (float): Estimated gamma parameter. - DeltaS (np.array): Changes in S(t). - S_mid (np.array): Midpoints of S(t). - intercept (float): Intercept of the log-log regression. - slope (float): Slope of the log-log regression (negative gamma). - nrows (int): Number of rows in the dataset. - n_data (int): Total data points available.

class ScalingLawsCalc: 
3422class ScalingLawsCalc:
3423    """
3424    A class for processing animal trajectory data, performing
3425    statistical analyses, and generating a PDF report with results.
3426
3427    Attributes:
3428        data (TrajectoriesFrame): The trajectory data of animals.
3429        animal_name (str): Name of the dataset.
3430        output_dir (str): Directory to store the output files.
3431        output_dir_animal (str): Path for the specific dataset output.
3432        pdf (FPDF): PDF object to generate reports.
3433        stats_frame (DataSetStats): Object for tracking dataset statistics.
3434    """
3435
3436    def __init__(
3437        self,
3438        data: TrajectoriesFrame,
3439        data_name: str,
3440        output_dir: str,
3441        stats_frame: DataSetStats,
3442    ) -> None:
3443        """
3444        Initializes the ScalingLawsCalc class.
3445
3446        Args:
3447            data (TrajectoriesFrame): The trajectory dataset.
3448            data_name (str): The name of the dataset.
3449            output_dir (str): Directory to save output files.
3450            stats_frame (DataSetStats): Object to store statistics
3451                of the dataset.
3452
3453        Raises:
3454            FileExistsError: If the output directory for the dataset
3455                already exists.
3456        """
3457
3458        self.data = data
3459        self.animal_name = data_name
3460        self.output_dir = output_dir
3461        self.output_dir_animal = os.path.join(output_dir, data_name)
3462        self.pdf = FPDF()
3463        self.stats_frame = stats_frame
3464
3465        try:
3466            os.mkdir(self.output_dir_animal)
3467        except FileExistsError:
3468            raise FileExistsError(
3469                f"The directory {self.output_dir_animal} already exists. "
3470                f"Please remove it or specify a different name."
3471            )
3472
3473        self.pdf.add_page()
3474        self.pdf.set_auto_page_break(auto=True, margin=15)
3475        self.pdf.set_font("Arial", "B", size=12)
3476        self.pdf.cell(
3477            200, 10, text=f"{self.animal_name.replace('_',' ')}", ln=True, align="C"
3478        )
3479        self.pdf.set_font("Arial", size=9)
3480        self.pdf.ln(5)
3481
3482
3483    def _preprocess_data(self) -> TrajectoriesFrame:
3484        """
3485        Preprocesses the trajectory data by filtering, converting
3486        coordinate systems, and calculating summary statistics.
3487
3488        Returns:
3489            TrajectoriesFrame: The preprocessed trajectory data.
3490        """
3491
3492        preproc = Prepocessing()
3493        stats = Stats()
3494        mean_points_values = preproc.get_mean_points(self.data)
3495        compressed_points = preproc.set_start_stop_time(mean_points_values)
3496        converted_to_cartesian = preproc.set_crs(compressed_points)
3497        filtered_animals = preproc.filter_by_quartiles(converted_to_cartesian)
3498        self.stats_frame.add_data({"animal_no": stats.get_animals_no(self.data)})
3499        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3500            {"animal_after_filtration": stats.get_animals_no(filtered_animals)}
3501        )
3502        self.stats_frame.add_data({"time_period": stats.get_period(filtered_animals)})
3503
3504        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3505            {
3506                "min_label_no": [
3507                    [f"user_id : {index}", f"no: {value}"]
3508                    for index, value in stats.get_min_labels_no_after_filtration(
3509                        filtered_animals
3510                    ).items()
3511                ]
3512            }
3513        )
3514
3515        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3516            {
3517                "min_records": [
3518                    [f"user_id : {index}", f"no: {value}"]
3519                    for index, value in stats.get_min_records_no_before_filtration(
3520                        self.data
3521                    ).items()
3522                ]
3523            }
3524        )
3525
3526        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3527            {"avg_duration": stats.get_mean_periods(filtered_animals)}
3528        )
3529        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3530            {"min_duration": stats.get_min_periods(filtered_animals)}
3531        )
3532        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3533            {"max_duration": stats.get_max_periods(filtered_animals)}
3534        )
3535        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3536            {"overall_set_area": stats.get_overall_area(filtered_animals)}
3537        )
3538        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3539            {"average_set_area": stats.get_mean_area(filtered_animals)}
3540        )
3541        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3542            {"min_area": stats.get_min_area(filtered_animals)}
3543        )
3544        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3545            {"max_area": stats.get_max_area(filtered_animals)}
3546        )
3547
3548        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3549            {
3550                "mean_label_no": stats.get_mean_labels_no_after_filtration(
3551                    filtered_animals
3552                )
3553            }
3554        )
3555        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3556            {"std_label_no": stats.get_std_labels_no_after_filtration(
3557                filtered_animals)
3558            }
3559        )
3560        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3561            {"mean_records": stats.get_mean_records_no_before_filtration(
3562                self.data)
3563            }
3564        )
3565        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3566            {"std_records": stats.get_std_records_no_before_filtration(
3567                self.data)
3568            }
3569        )
3570        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3571            {"std_duration": stats.get_std_periods(filtered_animals)}
3572        )
3573        self.stats_frame.add_data(
3574            {"std_area": stats.get_std_area(filtered_animals)}
3575        )
3576
3577        return filtered_animals
3578
3579
3580    def _advenced_preprocessing(self):
3581        """
3582        Performs advanced preprocessing by filtering, filling missing data,
3583        and calculating distinct locations over time.
3584
3585        Returns:
3586            tuple: Processed data, number of rows, data index, and unique
3587                locations count.
3588        """
3589
3590        preproc = Prepocessing()
3591        filtrated_data = preproc.filter_by_quartiles(self.data)
3592        data = (
3593            filtrated_data.reset_index()
3594            .drop(columns=["Unnamed: 0", "geometry"])
3595            .drop_duplicates()
3596            .set_index("user_id")
3597        )
3598        filled_data = preproc.filing_data(data)
3599        nrows = int(filled_data.groupby(level=0).apply(lambda x: len(x)).min())
3600        n_data = np.arange(1, nrows + 1)
3601        S_data = [
3602            filled_data.groupby(level=0)["new_sum"].nth(x).mean() for x in range(nrows)
3603        ]
3604
3605        return filled_data, nrows, n_data, S_data
3606
3607
3608    def process_file(self) -> None:
3609        """
3610        Main processing function that executes preprocessing,
3611        statistical analysis, and generates a PDF report with various
3612        scaling laws.
3613        """
3614
3615        self.stats_frame.add_data({"animal": self.animal_name})
3616
3617        filtered_animals = self._preprocess_data()
3618        filtered_animals.to_csv(
3619            os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"compressed_{self.animal_name}.csv")
3620        )
3621        filled_data, nrows, n_data, S_data = self._advenced_preprocessing()
3622
3623        min_label_no = [
3624            [value]
3625            for index, value in Stats()
3626            .get_min_labels_no_after_filtration(filtered_animals)
3627            .items()
3628        ][0][0]
3629
3630        min_records = [
3631            [value]
3632            for index, value in Stats()
3633            .get_min_records_no_before_filtration(self.data)
3634            .items()
3635        ][0][0]
3636
3637        laws = Laws(
3638            pdf_object=self.pdf,
3639            stats_frame=self.stats_frame,
3640            output_path=self.output_dir_animal,
3641        )
3642        laws.visitation_frequency(filtered_animals, min_label_no)
3643        laws.distinct_locations_over_time(nrows, n_data, S_data)
3644        laws.msd_curve_split(filled_data)
3645        laws.rog_over_time(filtered_animals, min_records)
3646        self.pdf.add_page()
3647        laws.waiting_times(filtered_animals)
3648        laws.jump_lengths_distribution(filtered_animals)
3649        laws.travel_times(filtered_animals)
3650        laws.rog(filtered_animals)
3651        laws.msd_distribution(filtered_animals)
3652        laws.return_time_distribution(filtered_animals)
3653        laws.exploration_time(filtered_animals)
3654        laws.estimate_pnew(filled_data)
3655
3656        pdf_path = os.path.join(
3657            self.output_dir_animal, f"{self.animal_name}.pdf"
3658        )
3659        self.pdf.output(pdf_path)
3660
3661        self.stats_frame.add_record()

A class for processing animal trajectory data, performing statistical analyses, and generating a PDF report with results.

Attributes: data (TrajectoriesFrame): The trajectory data of animals. animal_name (str): Name of the dataset. output_dir (str): Directory to store the output files. output_dir_animal (str): Path for the specific dataset output. pdf (FPDF): PDF object to generate reports. stats_frame (DataSetStats): Object for tracking dataset statistics.

3442    ) -> None:

3448            data_name (str): The name of the dataset.

3450            stats_frame (DataSetStats): Object to store statistics
3451                of the dataset.
3452
3453        Raises:
3454            FileExistsError: If the output directory for the dataset
3455                already exists.

3478        )

Initializes the ScalingLawsCalc class.

Args: data (TrajectoriesFrame): The trajectory dataset. data_name (str): The name of the dataset. output_dir (str): Directory to save output files. stats_frame (DataSetStats): Object to store statistics of the dataset.

Raises: FileExistsError: If the output directory for the dataset already exists.

def process_file(self) -> None: 
3608    def process_file(self) -> None:
3609        """
3610        Main processing function that executes preprocessing,
3611        statistical analysis, and generates a PDF report with various
3612        scaling laws.
3613        """
3614
3615        self.stats_frame.add_data({"animal": self.animal_name})
3616
3617        filtered_animals = self._preprocess_data()
3618        filtered_animals.to_csv(
3619            os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"compressed_{self.animal_name}.csv")
3620        )
3621        filled_data, nrows, n_data, S_data = self._advenced_preprocessing()
3622
3623        min_label_no = [
3624            [value]
3625            for index, value in Stats()
3626            .get_min_labels_no_after_filtration(filtered_animals)
3627            .items()
3628        ][0][0]
3629
3630        min_records = [
3631            [value]
3632            for index, value in Stats()
3633            .get_min_records_no_before_filtration(self.data)
3634            .items()
3635        ][0][0]
3636
3637        laws = Laws(
3638            pdf_object=self.pdf,
3639            stats_frame=self.stats_frame,
3640            output_path=self.output_dir_animal,
3641        )
3642        laws.visitation_frequency(filtered_animals, min_label_no)
3643        laws.distinct_locations_over_time(nrows, n_data, S_data)
3644        laws.msd_curve_split(filled_data)
3645        laws.rog_over_time(filtered_animals, min_records)
3646        self.pdf.add_page()

3648        laws.jump_lengths_distribution(filtered_animals)
3649        laws.travel_times(filtered_animals)
3650        laws.rog(filtered_animals)
3651        laws.msd_distribution(filtered_animals)
3652        laws.return_time_distribution(filtered_animals)
3653        laws.exploration_time(filtered_animals)
3654        laws.estimate_pnew(filled_data)
3655

3657            self.output_dir_animal, f"{self.animal_name}.pdf"
3658        )
3659        self.pdf.output(pdf_path)
3660
3661        self.stats_frame.add_record()

Main processing function that executes preprocessing, statistical analysis, and generates a PDF report with various scaling laws.
